subject: RE: [junit] fundamental questions on JUnit
msgSnippet: ... JUnit (AFAIK) does not report code coverage, if that s what you re asking. It won t tell you what lines were not executed after a test suite run is done.
messageBody:
> Here are two execution paths within a procedure. Both
> result1 and result2 might be identical in value some
> of the time, for a many to one function. Using Junit,
> how can one know that both paths have been exercised
> or tested?

JUnit (AFAIK) does not report code coverage, if that's what you're asking.
It won't tell you what lines were not executed after a test suite run is
done. Code coverage tools can help show you areas missed by testing, but
they aren't perfect. I'm not Java experienced enough to know what Java
coverage tools are out there.

Chris
